> sheesh,  I better get on my horse.

Hehe, I'm on uni holidays for the next week and a half, but the workload
won't pickup till a couple of weeks after that so I've got a lot of free
time :)

> I should  have some time to work on
> it tomorrow.  Is there a problem with just reading the file in parts,
> through a buffer, and writing it to another file?  That way it's not
> necesarry to actually load the whole file in memory, it just converts
> it.

Yup that will work - read, analyse and then write out for each individual
part.
It was how I was initially doing it until I sat down and thought about it
and what I could make into a reusable component for the scenario editor.

> Of course that won't be much good for the scenario editor, but for
> a file conversion utility it should be ok right?

Yep for just the converter it'll be fine.

> Now if I could only
> remember all the basic stuff I used to know about C programming ;ï¿½

Yes that'd come in handy I think.
If you (or the other coders) need some help just let me know.

- Deathifier
